greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least triangular number divisible by n-th prime.
comment: Essentially the same as A008837; only the first terms differ.
mathematica: With[{tr=Accumulate[Range[300]]},Table[SelectFirst[tr,Divisible[#,Prime[n]]&],{n,50}]] (* Requires Mathematica version 10 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 06 2018 *)
program: (PARI) T(n) = n*(n+1)/2 for(n=1,100, p=prime(n); tr=1; while(T(tr)%p<>0, tr++); print1(T(tr),","))
xref: Cf. A000217 (triangular numbers), A008837 (p(p-1)/2 for p prime).
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_, Sep 06 2005
